verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH1961> in the month<WH2320> Nisan,<WH5212> in the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king,<WH4428> that wine<WH3196> was before<WH6440> him: and I took up<WH5375> <WH853> the wine,<WH3196> and gave<WH5414> it unto the king.<WH4428> Now I had not<WH3808> been<WH1961> formerly sad<WH7451> in his presence.<WH6440>

Wherefore the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me, Why<WH4069> is thy countenance<WH6440> sad,<WH7451> seeing thou<WH859> art not<WH369> sick?<WH2470> this<WH2088> is nothing<WH369> else but<WH3588> <WH518> sorrow<WH7455> of heart.<WH3820> Then I was very<WH3966> sore<WH7235> afraid,<WH3372>

And said<WH559> unto the king,<WH4428> Let the king<WH4428> live<WH2421> forever:<WH5769> why<WH4069> should not<WH3808> my countenance<WH6440> be sad,<WH7489> when<WH834> the city,<WH5892> the place<WH1004> of my fathers'<WH1> sepulchers,<WH6913> lieth waste,<WH2720> and the gates<WH8179> thereof are consumed<WH398> with fire?<WH784>
Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me, For<WH5921> what<WH4100> <WH2088> dost thou<WH859> make request?<WH1245> So I prayed<WH6419> to<WH413> the God<WH430> of heaven.<WH8064>

And I said<WH559> unto the king,<WH4428> If<WH518> it please<WH2895> <WH5921> the king,<WH4428> and if<WH518> thy servant<WH5650> have found favor<WH3190> in thy sight,<WH6440> that<WH834> thou wouldest send<WH7971> me unto<WH413> Judah,<WH3063> unto<WH413> the city<WH5892> of my fathers'<WH1> sepulchers,<WH6913> that I may build<WH1129> it.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto me, (the queen<WH7694> also sitting<WH3427> by<WH681> him,) For<WH5704> how long<WH4970> shall thy journey<WH4109> be?<WH1961> and when<WH4970> wilt thou return?<WH7725> So it pleased<WH3190> <WH6440> the king<WH4428> to send<WH7971> me; and I set<WH5414> him a time.<WH2165>

Moreover I said<WH559> unto the king,<WH4428> If<WH518> it please<WH2895> <WH5921> the king,<WH4428> let letters<WH107> be given<WH5414> me to<WH5921> the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the river,<WH5104> that<WH834> they may convey me over<WH5674> till<WH5704> <WH834> I come<WH935> into<WH413> Judah;<WH3063>

And a letter<WH107> unto<WH413> Asaph<WH623> the keeper<WH8104> of the king's<WH4428> forest,<WH6508> that<WH834> he may give<WH5414> me timber<WH6086> to make beams<WH7136> for<WH853> the gates<WH8179> of the palace<WH1002> which<WH834> appertained to the house,<WH1004> and for the wall<WH2346> of the city,<WH5892> and for the house<WH1004> that<WH834> I shall enter<WH935> into.<WH413> And the king<WH4428> granted<WH5414> me, according to the good<WH2896> hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> upon<WH5921> me.

Then I came<WH935> to<WH413> the governors<WH6346> beyond<WH5676> the river,<WH5104> and gave<WH5414> them<WH853> the king's<WH4428> letters.<WH107> Now the king<WH4428> had sent<WH7971> captains<WH8269> of the army<WH2428> and horsemen<WH6571> with<WH5973> me.

When Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite,<WH2772> and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant,<WH5650> the Ammonite,<WH5984> heard<WH8085> of it, it grieved<WH7489> them exceedingly<WH1419> <WH7451> that<WH834> there was come<WH935> a man<WH120> to seek<WH1245> the welfare<WH2896> of the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>
So I came<WH935> to<WH413> Jerusalem,<WH3389> and was<WH1961> there<WH8033> three<WH7969> days.<WH3117>

And I arose<WH6965> in the night,<WH3915> I<WH589> and some few<WH4592> men<WH376> with<WH5973> me; neither<WH3808> told<WH5046> I any man<WH120> what<WH4100> my God<WH430> had put<WH5414> in<WH413> my heart<WH3820> to do<WH6213> at Jerusalem:<WH3389> neither<WH369> was there any beast<WH929> with<WH5973> me, save<WH3588> <WH518> the beast<WH929> that<WH834> I<WH589> rode<WH7392> upon.

And I went out<WH3318> by night<WH3915> by the gate<WH8179> of the valley,<WH1516> even before<WH413> <WH6440> the dragon<WH8577> well,<WH5869> and to<WH413> the dung<WH830> port,<WH8179> and viewed<WH1961> <WH7663> the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> which<WH834> were broken down,<WH6555> and the gates<WH8179> thereof were consumed<WH398> with fire.<WH784>

Then I went on<WH5674> to<WH413> the gate<WH8179> of the fountain,<WH5869> and to<WH413> the king's<WH4428> pool:<WH1295> but there was no<WH369> place<WH4725> for the beast<WH929> that was under<WH8478> me to pass.<WH5674>

Then went I up<WH1961> <WH5927> in the night<WH3915> by the brook,<WH5158> and viewed<WH1961> <WH7663> the wall,<WH2346> and turned back,<WH7725> and entered<WH935> by the gate<WH8179> of the valley,<WH1516> and so returned.<WH7725>

And the rulers<WH5461> knew<WH3045> not<WH3808> whither<WH575> I went,<WH1980> or what<WH4100> I<WH589> did;<WH6213> neither<WH3808> had I as<WH5704> yet<WH3651> told<WH5046> it to the Jews,<WH3064> nor to the priests,<WH3548> nor to the nobles,<WH2715> nor to the rulers,<WH5461> nor to the rest<WH3499> that did<WH6213> the work.<WH4399>

Then said<WH559> I unto<WH413> them, Ye<WH859> see<WH7200> the distress<WH7451> that<WH834> we<WH587> are in, how<WH834> Jerusalem<WH3389> lieth waste,<WH2720> and the gates<WH8179> thereof are burned<WH3341> with fire:<WH784> come,<WH1980> and let us build up<WH1129> <WH853> the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> that we be<WH1961> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> a reproach.<WH2781>

Then I told<WH5046> them of<WH853> the hand<WH3027> of my God<WH430> which<WH834> <WH1931> was good<WH2896> upon<WH5921> me; as also<WH637> the king's<WH4428> words<WH1697> that<WH834> he had spoken<WH559> unto me. And they said,<WH559> Let us rise up<WH6965> and build.<WH1129> So they strengthened<WH2388> their hands<WH3027> for this good<WH2896> work.

But when Sanballat<WH5571> the Horonite,<WH2772> and Tobiah<WH2900> the servant,<WH5650> the Ammonite,<WH5984> and Geshem<WH1654> the Arabian,<WH6163> heard<WH8085> it, they laughed us to scorn,<WH3932> and despised<WH959> <WH5921> us, and said,<WH559> What<WH4100> is this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> that<WH834> ye<WH859> do?<WH6213> will ye<WH859> rebel<WH4775> against<WH5921> the king?<WH4428>

Then answered<WH7725> <WH1697> I them, and said<WH559> unto them, The God<WH430> of heaven,<WH8064> he<WH1931> will prosper<WH6743> us; therefore we<WH587> his servants<WH5650> will arise<WH6965> and build:<WH1129> but ye have no<WH369> portion,<WH2506> nor right,<WH6666> nor memorial,<WH2146> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>
